title: Question 61

children: A 25-year-old woman is evaluated for fever, generalized lymphadenopathy, and the painless genital lesions
Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
The most likely diagnosis is secondary syphilis. This patient has condylomata lata lesions involving the vulva and anal region, caused by

. Condylomata lata can be a manifestation of secondary syphilis and present as painless, gray, raised papules appearing on the vulva and near the anus, or in any other warm, moist areas, such as the mouth or intertriginous regions. Condylomata lata are typically located near the primary chancre. These lesions are very infectious.

objective.__html: Diagnose condylomata lata and its association with secondary syphilis.
